keywords.term: United States District Court For the District of Arizona

org.orgName: District Court of the United States

div1.p: UNITED STATES OF AMERICA District of Arizon. } ss.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES IN AND FOR THE DISTRICT OF ARIZONA, at the MAY term thereof, A.D. 1916.

The Grand Jurors of the United States, impaneled, sworn and charged at the term aforesaid, of the Court aforesaid, on their oath present that Leroy Smith on the 7th day of April A.D. 1916, and within the said District of Arizona, did wrongfully, unlawfully and feloniously have in his possession and under his control a certain manufacture, derivative and preparation of opium, to-wit, five ounces of morphine, without first having registered with the Collector of Internal Revenue of the United States for the District of New Mexico, or with any collector of internal revenue of the United States, as requried and provided for by an Act of Congress entitled, "An Act to provide for the registration of, with collectors of internal revenue, and to impose a special tax upon all persons who produce, import, manufacture, compound, deal in, dispense, sell, distribute, or give away opium or coca leaves, their salts, derivatives, or preparations, and for other purposes", approved December 17, 1914, and without first having paid the special tax provided for by said Act of Congress, contrary to the form of dignity of the United States of America.

And the Grand Jurors aforesaid, upon their oath aforesaid, do further present that Leroy Smith, on the 7th day of April, A.D/ 1916 and within the District of Arizona, did wrongfully, unlawfully and feloniously have in his possession and under his control a certain manufacture, derivative and preparation of coca leaves, to-wit, five ounces of cocaine, without first having registered with the Collector of Internal Revenue of the United States for the District of New Mexico, or with any collector of internal revenue of the United States, as required and provided for by an Act of Congress entitled, "An Act to provide for the registration of, with collectors of internal revenue, and to impose a special tax upon all persons who produce, import, manufacture, compound, deal in, dispense, sell, distribute, or give away opium or coca leaves, their salts, derivatives, or preparations, and for other purposes," approved December 17, 1914, and without first having paid the special tax provided for by said Act of Congress,
contrary in the form of the statute in such case made a provided and against the peace and dignity of the United States of America
Thomas A. Flynn, UNITED STATES ATTORNEY FOR THE DISTRICT OF ARIZONA.
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF ARIZONA

p.add: Read quilty May 15 - 1916. Tuson Ari Judge Sawtelle

div1.p: UNITED STATES OF AMERICA vs. Leroy Smith
Geo. F. Kitt Foreman of the Grand Jury.
Witnesses examined before the Grand Jury: Herbert R. Chatham W.J. Gorman
Presented to the Court in the presence of the Grand Jury by their Foreman, and filed this 8th day of May, A.D. 1916 Mose Drachman. Clerk.
